job_title: Lead Data Analyst - Systems Administration and Analytics
summary:
About us

National Grid is Hiring a Lead Analyst - Systems Administration and Analytics in our Waltham, MA location.
Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.
To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business.
Job Purpose

The Systems Administration and Analytics department is responsible for managing cross-functional business systems that supports project estimating. You will work closely with leaders across the Capital Delivery organization to improve business processes and identify data driven solutions. Gaining a deep understanding of the requirements that drive business process and the technologies that enable them you will conduct analyses to identify deficiencies, needs, and opportunities to improve our use of technology and data.
In this role, you will also interface with end-users from estimating departments and Capital Delivery business areas to identify business capability gaps and opportunities for new and existing systems, collect and document requirements to fill these gaps, support execution of approved plans and systems, maintain and utilize data systems.
Key Accountabilities

Data Analysis & Reporting:
Conduct analysis using statistical software, databases, and spreadsheets (can write advanced macros and maintain complex spreadsheets)
Perform data cleansing, analysis and monitoring to ensure data quality throughout the end to end process
Manage and integrate multiple sources of data by developing data flows and interpreting data models
Develop, build and analyse dashboards and reports to monitor metrics and KPI’s
Data Management:
Champion data management practices with our stakeholders focused on continuous development of data maturity models
Monitor data quality scorecards and data integrity efforts with data owners/stewards to resolve data quality issues
Database / Technical:
Work with data providers in internal client organizations, specifically in the development of data requests, checking of data received and following up with data providers on data issues.
Develop scripts and queries, ETL data from different sources utilizing SQL and data ETL software
Assemble and maintain databases/data systems
Ability to transition from legacy systems and processes to efficient best practices
Deal directly with clients on projects involving technical methodologies
Identify opportunities to improve alignment between business processes and systems.

Supervisory/Interpersonal- Experience Required

 Strong interpersonal skills including negotiations and communications.
Ability to influence key stakeholders and lead a group even where the role holder has no direct authority.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university preferably in a technical field required (Engineering, Computer Science, Business Analytics or Management Information Systems)
7+ years of consistent track record in Analytics and development and application of data management policies and compliance
3+ years of Database and SQL knowledge
Experience with utilizing advanced statistical methods and simulations to develop prescriptive and predictive models
Experience working with large operational data sets, involving categorical data for solving classification problems, is a plus.
Expert data visualization techniques for charts and reports - Good knowledge of PowerBI, Tableau
Unstructured Data handling - Know best practices on how to stage unstructured data and model it to solve the problem at hand
More Information

National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent, knowledge, experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities, women, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.

job Description: Quality Assurance Manager will manage Quality Assurance department and personnel.Job Responsibilities: The Quality Assurance Manager will direct and manage quality assurance and food safety systems. The Quality Assurance Manager will be responsible for implementing and promoting quality achievement and performance. The position will manage inspections and audits by regulatory agencies (USDA, FDA), customers, and third-party auditing companies. QA manager will direct compliance to quality, GFSI standards, GMP’s, HACCP, sanitation, pest control and Food Defense. QA Manager will be responsible for 1st and 2nd shift QA staff. We enjoy the important work we do every day on behalf of our members.
Job Summary
We are looking for an experienced reporting analyst. Under the direction of the Manager of Reporting & Analytics, the reporting analyst will be responsible for working with business and technical stakeholders to support analysis, design, development and testing of various reports that support critical business needs. The analyst will also ensure a high level of advanced customer service increasing the team’s outreach by building and maintaining relationships with other departments and stakeholders at Tufts Health Plan. The analyst is responsible to ensure the analysis and completion of various regulatory reporting requirements, monthly and quarterly claims and financial reporting and other corporate reporting, as well as supporting analysis to other departments such as Health Care Services and the Public Plans and Senior Products Teams.

The analyst will be required to work with numerous departments across the company and participate in various cross functional workgroups. The analyst must be able to work within a highly effective team as well as work independently to perform analytical and technical tasks.

Excellent and proven ability in utilizing complex reporting and data mining tools such as Cognos, SQL, and MS Access is highly preferred and demonstrated advanced Excel skills are required.

Day-to-day work is a combination of new projects, maintaining existing projects, and standard reporting. This role will work closely with a variety of THP departments including Business Implementation, Regulatory, Product, Strategy & Analytics etc.
Job Description
Requirements
What we build together changes our customer's health for the better. We are looking for talented and innovative people to join our team. Come join us!

City Of ChicopeeAssessors’ OfficeAdministrative AssistantThe City of Chicopee’s Assessors’ Office is seeking a professional and experienced leader to fulfill the duties in the role of Administrative Assistant. This is an opportunity to dedicate time to help with the needs of others, the City, contribute and be a part of a positive team.The Administrative Assistant performs a variety of secretarial, clerical, and administrative tasks in support of the Board of Assessors and Assistant Assessors. The Administrative Assistant is responsible for the supervision of three clerical positions, recording of all real estate ownership transfers, abatements and denials.Essential Duties include:Supervises other clerical staffManages office payroll records, correspondence and office receiptsPerforms bookkeeping, accounts payable and purchasingIs an expert on real estate transactions and mappingPrimarily responsible for the following:The recording of all real estate transfersReview applications in detail for ownership, income and expense information and personally contacts all applicants that need to submit further information or clarify information.Reviews all deeds for accuracy in conveyance terms and descriptive termsPerforms title research on the Registry of Deeds website and in the officeMaintains property record cards and real estate ownership databasesResponsible for the providing the monthly changes and updates to the Planning Department for the city’s GIS systemChecks list of deeds compiled by document number against entry books at Registry of Deeds. company_name: St. Mary's Center for Women and Children
summary: St. Mary's Center for Women and Children offers innovative and family-centered programs for women and children who have experienced trauma and are living in poverty. Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of stablecoins and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide. Circle's platform has supported over 100 million transactions worth tens of billions of dollars, with nearly 10 million retail customers, over a thousand businesses, while storing and securing more than $5 billion in digital currency assets. Today, Circle's transactional services, business accounts, and platform APIs are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity for all through programmable internet commerce.

What you'll be part of:

With the mission "To raise global economic prosperity through programmable internet commerce," Circle was founded on the belief that blockchains and digital currency will rewire the global economic system, creating a fundamentally more open, inclusive, efficient and integrated world economy. We envision a global economy where people and businesses everywhere can more freely connect and transact with each other with new technologies for digital money. We believe such a system can raise prosperity for people and companies everywhere. Our mission is powered by the values we espouse and which we expect all Circlers to respect. We are Multistakeholder, serving the needs of our customers, our shareholders, our employees and families, our local communities and our world. Furthermore, we are also Mindful, Driven by Excellence, and High Integrity.

What you'll be responsible for:

As a Talent Coordinator, you'll join a team focused on helping Circle's employees be as effective as possible. You will assist in the company's growth and scale by providing the best in class service to Circle's global workforce. You will work closely with the other members of the Talent team to understand and master current processes, then find ways to streamline and improve, and ultimately own them. We're looking for an ambitious, quick-learning, highly motivated individual who seeks a collaborative, iterative, and fast-paced environment. You will have an opportunity to grow your career in an exponential way but will require your hard work and dedication.

What you'll work on:

Administer global health, dental, vision, life and other insurance plan benefits including enrollments, changes, and terminations. Assist in the annual renewal process. Conduct audits of talent systems and invoices to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Provide ad hoc administrative support and assistance to the SVP, Talent and other members of the Talent team.
Coordinate interviews and assist with the recruitment process.
Facilitate payroll processes for US and international locations.
Perform US and international onboarding processes such as background checks, I-9 documentation, benefit education, HRIS data entry, and scheduling coordination.
Assist with processing of terminations including updating HRIS, benefits, and COBRA administration.
Participate in other Talent duties as assigned such as immigration, talent reporting and analytics, equity administration, policy implementation, process documentation, and employee communication.

You will aspire to our four core values:

Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.
Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.
High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you'll bring to Circle:

Strong work ethic with aspirations to advance career.
Extreme attention to detail and ability to stay organized.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Can do, customer-focused attitude.
Mature ability to keep information confidential.
1+ years of experience with Human Resources.
Bachelor's degree preferred but not required.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Video Specialist - Customer Education

Now, more than ever, the Toast team is committed to our customers. We're taking steps to help restaurants navigate these unprecedented times with technology, resources, and community. Our focus is on building the restaurant platform that helps restaurants adapt, take control, and get back to what they do best: building the businesses they love. And because our technology is purpose-built for restaurants, by restaurant people, restaurants can trust that we'll deliver on their needs for today while investing in experiences that will power their restaurant of the future.

Bready* to make a change?


At Toast, we put our customers first. There is already a lot for members of the restaurant community to know, so when they have a question about Toast, we want them to be able to find the answer FAST! In the Video Specialist role, you'll be expected to know the Toast product, know the Toast customers, and develop a video strategy to help keep them informed.

About this roll* (Responsibilities)

Write, edit and publish self-help articles onto Toast Central
Audit and update existing video content in our video library based on product updates
Create new scripts and shoot as much in house content as possible for new educational video needs
Meet with cross-functional partners to validate and scope where new video content is needed
Project manage content calendar for video updates and releases
Handle the admin elements of running Toast Classroom videos. This includes securing host, managing schedules for back-ups, scheduling chat owners, and analyzing impact data
Develop resources for customers post-training based on trends within questions of Toast Classroom sessions
Pilot and host weekly live workshop sessions to support self-install customers complete Go-Lives faster.
Scope and maintain a new certification tool to help rebuild Toast University

Do you have the right ingredients*? (Requirements)

Strong writing skills, with the ability to convert complex topics into simple steps
Strong organizational skills
Self-motivated
Understanding of restaurant operations and workflows
Previous experience with Toast product is a plus but not required.
Experience with video editing software

Bread puns encouraged but not required

The Town of South Hadley is seeking applicants for the position of full time Wastewater Treatment Plant Supervisor for the WWTP and 4 pumping stations. This individual will be responsible for directing all operations concerned with the treatment, maintenance, operation and administration of plant functions and personnel.(Must apply through www.southhadley.org/jobs to be considered.)The successful candidate will have thorough knowledge of equipment, facilities, materials, methods and procedures used in water treatment systems; considerable knowledge of water treatment plant operation and maintenance. Skill in operation of the listed tools and equipment. Ability to interpret specific chemical and biological analyses; ability to guide, direct and motivate employees; ability to plan, organize and supervise the activities of work crew performing construction and maintenance work. Ability to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing; intermediate office skills, ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, other departments and the public.The candidate will need to be proficient in the operations and maintenance of a wastewater treatment plant and pumping stations, in order to meet Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and Massachusetts General Law requirements. Prepares for DEP and EPA requirements, all written annual reports and inspections on sludge, alarms, inspections of pumping stations, staffing, sewer collection systems, and nitrogen removal.Assigns daily work, plans, schedules and implements construction, maintenance, and operation and construction activities designed to provide quality wastewater treatment for the town; oversees construction and maintenance work to determine acceptability and conformance to standards.Analyzes and evaluates operation and maintenance functions; initiates and recommends new and improved practices. Coordinates, assigns and directs preparation of data and related reports to meet the requirements of the EPA, MA DEP or other organizations as needed. Coordinates and reviews all relative data related to the treatment plant and pumping stations. Designates essential personnel.Licensure requirements include Massachusetts State Wastewater Treatment Certification Grade VI (6) or VII (7), Grade III (3) Collection System certification preferred as established by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts Board of Certification of Operators of Water Treatment Facilities.Educational & experience requirements include Associate’s Degree in physical, chemical, or biological sciences, or a closely related field; and five (5) years of experience in operating Grade VII (6) or VII (7) water treatment facilities with at least 3 years in a supervisory capacity or any equivalent combination of education and experience.Salary range $64,000 – $70,000 DOE/DOQ and contingent upon a successful CORI check.To submit an application and view our unabridged job description; please visit our website at: www.southhadley.org/jobsThis posting will remain active until filled.The Town of South Hadley is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.Job Type: Full-timePay: $60,000.00 - $70,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceEmployee assistance programFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offRetirement planVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayWork Location:One locationThis Job Is:A job for which military experienced candidates are encouraged to applyA job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to applyCompany's website:www.southhadley.org/jobsBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:No

Working at MIT offers opportunities, an environment, a culture – and benefits – that just aren’t found together anywhere else. If you’re curious, motivated, want to be part of a unique community, and help shape the future – then take a look at this opportunity.

PROGRAM ADMINISTRATOR, GRADUATE STUDENT FAMILIES, Office of Graduate Education (OGE), to serve as the primary point of contact and a central resource for information and support services to graduate students in their role as parents. Will help students connect with programs, policies, and other resources to help improve the experience and alleviate the stressors related to raising a family while being a student. Responsibilities include managing a portfolio of MIT-administered programs for student parents, advising students on relevant policies/procedures, and delivering services to student parents (e.g., events, workshops, orientations, and other guidance and support); collaborating with other OGE staff and working with academic departments and partners across MIT in coordinating processes/programs such as childbirth accommodation and parental leave, graduate family portable grants, and community building programs; taking a primary lead on orchestrating some programs for student families and collaborating with Institute partners to offer others; contributing to the overall goals and objectives of the OGE, including support in strategic planning, program assessment, gap analysis, data collection, report generation, and other office- and Institute-wide projects/initiatives.

Job Requirements
REQUIRED: at least two years’ administrative and/or project/program administration experience; bachelor’s degree; strong organizational, interpersonal, and written and oral communication skills; self-motivation; ability to interact with and/or collaborate effectively across all levels, including with students, faculty, and administrators; knowledge of and appreciation for cross-cultural and bias issues and demonstrated ability to work with diverse populations; ability to listen carefully and communicate tactfully; experience with databases and proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Drupal or an equivalent web application. PREFERRED: master’s degree with emphasis on program coordination, assessment, higher education administration, academic advising, or related field. Job #18910-7

Salary range: $56,597-68,000

Working at MIT offers opportunities, an environment, a culture – and benefits – that just aren’t found together anywhere else. If you’re curious, motivated, want to be part of a unique community, and help shape the future – then take a look at this opportunity.

COMMUNICATIONS OFFICER, MIT Sandbox Innovation Fund Program (MIT Sandbox), to serve as a communications and content manager with responsibility for coordinating and creating content for the program and its international sister programs and for marketing, communication, and engagement functions. These responsibilities are critical to Sandbox’s sustainability and growth within the MIT community and internationally as it helps other institutions implement equivalent programs to expand the experience of MIT students (e.g., Explorer program in Morocco). Will lead the execution of Sandbox communication and marketing activities and the creation and implementation of content and materials; develop strategies for outbound marketing and communication in order to deepen and broaden Sandbox relationships; network and influence relationships through Sandbox marketing and group communications with target audiences to achieve communication and marketing objectives; partner with the executive director on communications and materials to the funding board, MIT, and UM6P (Mohammed VI Polytechnic University) senior leadership and to students and mentors; and establish tracking tools for and creates a strategy to update and maintain the Sandbox Websites.

The MIT Sandbox provides meaningful seed funding of up to $25,000 for student-initiated ideas, mentoring from within MIT and from a broad network of committed partners, and tailored educational experiences.

Job Requirements


REQUIRED: bachelor's degree in a related field; at least five years’ communications or marketing experience; ability to work in a team-oriented environment; excellent organizational, execution, interpersonal, presentation, and oral and written communication skills; experience with a CMS; proficiency with standard data management software such as Microsoft Office, G Suite, and SurveyMonkey; and ability to prioritize work in a fast-paced environment. Job #18833-8
Must be able to work occasional evening and weekend hours.

This a two-year term position that will be reviewed yearly.

Casa Myrna is Greater Boston’s foremost provider of solutions to end domestic and dating violence. The agency operates three residential programs in Boston for survivors and children made homeless by domestic violence, a comprehensive range of advocacy and supportive services, and SafeLink, Massachusetts’ statewide 24/7 toll-free domestic violence hotline. In addition, Casa Myrna works to end domestic and dating violence through education, awareness and prevention.Principal Duties and Responsibilities Ascertains callers’ needs and provides crisis intervention by: conducting safety assessment and safety planning, supportive listening, providing callers with information on and about domestic violence and its dynamics, and connecting callers to all appropriate resources.Accesses the on-line Bed Update in order to provide up-to-date shelter availability information for all callers seeking emergency shelter or safe home placement.Utilizes all resources to provide every caller with options for a safe place to stay for at least one night.Facilitates access to community and residential services by directly linking callers to those services state and nation-wide.Exhibits positive teamwork by collaborating with SafeLink staff on difficult calls, answering hotline calls when colleagues are busy or engaged in other work, and demonstrates behavior that is open to feedback and suggestions.Keeps abreast of domestic violence services and resources in order to deliver high quality service to callers. This includes attending monthly staff meetings, trainings and individual supervision meetings.Logs every call into SafeLink’s database to ensure accurate and complete collection of data.Exhibits excellent customer service skills when interacting with callers, staff, and external constituents. Transforming the Future with the Convergence of Simulation and Data


Data Engineer

Do you like a challenge, are you a complex thinker who likes to solve problems? If so, then you might be the new Altairian we are searching for. At Altair, your curiosity matters. We pride ourselves on a business culture that enables open, creative thinking, and we deeply value our employees and their contributions towards our clients' success, as well as our own.
Job Summary:

Altair Data Analytics solutions empowers individuals, teams, and entire organizations to evolve and expand the use of data for both operational efficiencies and analytical insights. Our market-leading products support self-service analytics, predictive analytics, and streaming analytics across a wide variety of industries and use cases.

Altair is looking for a highly motivated and energetic Data Engineer to join the Knowledge Works Professional Services team. We are looking for those with the ability to navigate and adapt in a fast-paced environment and help implement and integrate our new product into varied environments. A candidate for this position should be comfortable working in both on-premise as well as cloud environments; however, of the two, cloud experience is preferred.


What You Will Do:

Provide support to Altair Knowledge Works products like Monarch Server, Knowledge Hub, Knowledge Studio a comprehensive software platform that allows end users to perform in-depth analysis on their data while injecting predictive and complex statistics in the analysis.
Manage and deliver Data Engineering activities ranging from installation through project management and delivery.
Identify and solve technical and/or software issues, define system architecture, and analyze and implement hardware/software specifications.
Implement, test and provide guidance on solution deployments.
Work with team members and managers to monitor the overall quality and timeliness of project delivery.
Gather requirements and provide effort estimates for delivering Altair Knowledge Works solutions


What You Will Need:

Basics:

3+ years of experience identifying and solving technical and/or software issues, defining system architecture, and analyzing and implementing hardware/software specifications.
2+ years of experience in the field of Data Engineering
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Information Systems, Engineering, Computer Science or related field
Ability to travel on a project basis to client locations
Good Linux system administrator skills and TCP/IP network fundamentals
Experience with Cloud Computing technologies like AWS/Azure/GCP and/or Docker/Kubernetes
Ability to produce clear, detailed project scoping and design documentation to be used by technical specialists to build appropriate solutions for Altair Knowledge Works customers
Well versed in generic administration tasks of managing Docker images, container networking and standard infrastructure maintenance tasks on Docker and Kubernetes platform
Built and managed a container orchestration platform from the ground up
Experience with managing Docker Swarm
Experience in managing a large K8S cluster and scaling it significantly at enterprise scale
Experience with monitoring tools such as Grafana, and Kibana
Working experience/conceptual knowledge in BI/DWH/ETL concepts and tools
Professional Services and client facing experience
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral


How You Will Be Successful:

Envision the Future
Communicate Honestly and Broadly
Seek Technology and Business “Firsts”
Embrace Diversity and Take Risks


What We Offer:
Competitive Salary
Comprehensive Benefit Package
Outstanding Work/Life Balance
Flex Time
Paid Time Off and exceptional number of paid holidays
Paid Time Off for Community Service
Collaborative environment
Charitable Matching Program


Why Work with Us:

Altair is a global technology company that provides software and cloud solutions in the areas of product development, high performance computing (HPC) and data analytics. Altair enables organizations in nearly every industry to compete more effectively in a connected world, while creating a more sustainable future. With more than 3,000 engineers, scientists and creative thinkers in 25 countries, we help solve our customer’s toughest challenges and deliver unparalleled service, helping the innovators innovate, drive better decisions, and turn today’s problems into tomorrow’s opportunities.


Our vision is to transform customer decision making with simulation, data analytics, and high-performance computing.


For more than 30 years, we have been helping our customers integrate electronics and controls with mechanical design to expand product value, develop AI, simulation and data-driven digital twins to drive better decisions, and deliver advanced HPC and cloud solutions to support unlimited idea exploration. To learn more, please visit altair.com.
Ready to go? #ONLYFORWARD

Front Desk Agent responsibilities include registering guests, managing reservations and providing information about rooms, rates and amenities.If you have a knack for customer service and work experience in the hotel industry, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you will help create a pleasant and memorable stay for our guests.Responsibilities include:Perform all check-in and check-out tasksManage online and phone reservationsInform customers about payment methods and verify their credit card dataRegister guests collecting necessary information (like contact details and exact dates of their stay)Welcome guests upon their arrival and assign roomsProvide information about our hotel, available rooms, rates and amenitiesRespond to clients’ complaints in a timely and professional mannerLiaise with our housekeeping staff to ensure all rooms are clean, tidy and fully-furnished to accommodate guests’ needsMaintain updated records of bookings and paymentsRequirementsWork experience as a Hotel Front Desk Agent, Receptionist or similar roleExperience with hotel reservations software, like OPERA and/or CHOICEUnderstanding of how travel planning websites operate, like Booking and TripAdvisorCustomer service attitudeExcellent communication and organizational skillsWe are an Equal Opportunity Employer EEOJob Type: Full-timePay: $13.00 - $14.00 per hourBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftHolidaysMonday to FridayWeekendsCOVID-19 considerations:To keep our Front Desk Attendants as safe as possible we have installed clear plastic barriers and provide masks, gloves and hand sanitizer.Education:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Communication method(s) used:PhoneIn personBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:No

Part-Time Regulatory AssociateMilliporeSigma-Taunton, MA20 hours per week.DURATION: ASAP-1 year possible (extension or conversion to FTE)Your role: As a Dangerous Goods regulatory expert in the Global Hazard Communication function of the Life Science business sector, you are responsible for tracking and understanding regulatory requirements, implementing systems, data, and processes to support transport regulations with regard to Merck’s broad global Life Science product portfolio as well as further optimizing, streamlining and automating the global DG processes with regards to compliance and efficiency. The basic framework is constituted by the SAP module EHSM as the central data repository of substance data and RID/ADR, IMO, IATA classifications. In a global team, in day-to-day business or in global projects you assess dangerous goods classifications and determine packaging and transport restrictions as well as working with cross functional teams to develop compliant solutions that fulfill the business needs.Who you areSound knowledge of UN regulations concerning dangerous goods transport and professional expertise in DG transportation requirements (DOT, RID/ADR, IATA, IMO, PK1 certification).Capable of monitoring compliance of dangerous goods shipments – completed and in process – and of advising site personnel where corrections are needed.Willing to follow all site safety protocols and wearing of PPE. * Comfortable working in a warehouse environment and directing daily shipment modification as needed.Confidant in enforcing compliance with both internal and external parties.Experienced in providing employee training.Knowledgeable of shipment exceptions and how to apply these when necessary.Able to apply NFPA, other local EHS and fire codes as related to hazardous material storage.Able to function as a liaison for senior team members in the event of a government inspection and to help facilitate site inspections.Capable of directing follow-up on citations and taking any necessary corrective actions.Able to conduct internal audits of site activities and procedures and to prepare reports of findings.Willing to travel for offsite department meetings/workshops as needed.Strong project management and communication skills; willingness to work cooperatively within a global team.Team spirit, outstanding initiative, reliability and accuracy.Excellent English skills; German a plus.Experience with SAP EHSM, Oracle, knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Access is strongly preferred.EDUCATION: Bachelor's degree in Chemistry, science major and 1 to 3 years experience.MilliporeSigma is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.
